#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Montreal/Old Montreal
#Text=Old Montreal

#Text=( French : Vieux-Montréal ) is what many visitors come to Montreal for : old cobblestoned streets lined with buildings dating from the 17th through 19th centuries , grand old French restaurants , history museums , and the riverfront Old Port .

#Text=That 's not to say that Old Montreal is completely removed from the rest of Montreal — back a few blocks from the mimes and steakhouses , you 'll find warehouses converted to boutique shops and loft apartments .
#Text=During the summer , Place Jacques-Cartier is packed with street performers and restaurant terraces overflowing with tourists .
#Text=Winter presents a much more subdued scene , with bundled figures hurrying from gallery to restaurant to hotel in the cold and snow .
#Text=It is a mistake to call Old Montreal the " Old City " or " Old Town " .
#Text=Locals do not call it this , only guide books do .
#Text=By metro
#Text=Old Montreal is served by three metro stations — Square-Victoria , Champ-de-Mars , and Place-d'Armes .
#Text=They are a short walk into the heart of things , but there 's a bit of a hill .
#Text=By car
#Text=Street parking
#Text=is scarce and runs $ 3 per hour .
#Text=Parking complexes
#Text=run $6/1hr , $ 15 max , $ 20 for 12-24 hours .
#Text=Clock Tower Quay
#Text=, enter from rue Berri or rue de la Commune est.
#Text=Montréal Science Centre
#Text=, take boulevard Saint-Laurent or rue de la Commune .
#Text=Alexandra Quay
#Text=, either rue de la Callière or rue de la Commune ouest .
#Text=Complexe Chaussegros-de-Léry
#Text=, next to Champ-de-Mars metro , has over a thousand spots .
#Text=A few small commercial lots operate around City Hall for $20/day .
#Text=Note that the streets are small and one-way , and thronged with pedestrians in the summer .
#Text=Plans are in the works to turn rue Saint-Paul into a pedestrian walk , further complicating things .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Buses do n't run in Old Montreal itself , but they can get you within a few blocks .
#Text=From the Plateau , the 55 runs down Saint-Laurent to Saint-Jacques and up St. Urbain and the 30 runs down rue Berri ( 1 block east of Saint-Denis ) .
#Text=From downtown , take the 75 de la Commune , get off at McGill/Wellington : it 's then a four block walk to the edge of the cobblestone .
#Text=By boat
#Text=Ferries ( navettes ) run to and from Île Sainte-Hélène May to October and to the suburb of Longueuil on the south shore .
#Text=Get around
#Text=Old Montreal is small enough that walking is usually the best way to get around .
#Text=Sidewalks are narrow and the streets cobblestone , making slow going for wheelchairs and strollers .
#Text=Horse drawn carriages
#Text=( Calèche ) .
#Text=Carriage tours departed from Place d’Armes and the top and bottom of Place Jacques-Cartier .
#Text=Operation was suspended for a year in 2016 and is expected to end permanently at the end of 2019 . $ 45 for 30 min , $ 75 for 1 hour .
#Text=Segway Tours
#Text=, ☏ +1514 613-3300 , ✉ info@ecorecreo.ca .
#Text=Guided tours on a Segway upright scooter , which is a novelty in itself .
#Text=Old Montréal : The Official Walking Tour
#Text=, 110 rue Notre-Dame ouest ( in front of Notre-Dame Basilica ) .
#Text=May-Oct 11AM and 1PM .
#Text=This 90 minute tour will get you oriented .
#Text=$ 17.50 adult / $ 15.50 student and senior / $ 8.50 child .
#Text=Bike rentals
#Text=Vélo Aventure
#Text=, quai des Convoyeurs , ☏ +1514 288-8356 .
#Text=Summer bike and roller blade rentals .
#Text=Montréal On Wheels
#Text=Bikes , tandem bikes , roller blades , and accessories such as baby seats .
#Text=Bike tours also offered .
#Text=Weekdays $8/hr ; weekends $9/hr. .
#Text=See
#Text=Vieux-Port
#Text=( Old Port ) , South of rue Saint-Antoine between rue McGill and rue Berri ( metro Champ-de-Mars or Place-d'Armes ) .

#Text=The Old Port is a large waterfront green space with attractions such as Cirque du Soleil , the Montreal Science Center , the Labyrinth , the Clock Tower , and a large outdoor audio-visual stage which is the site for the Canada Day fireworks .
#Text=Place Jacques-Cartier
#Text=.
#Text=Pedestrian street filled with street artists and musicians , and there are numerous fine restaurants and private art galleries nearby .
#Text=Bonsecours Market
#Text=( Marché Bonsecours ) , 350 rue Saint-Paul est ( between rue Bonsecours and rue Saint-Claude ; metro Champ-de-Mars ) . 10AM-6PM daily .
#Text=Notre-Dame Basilica
#Text=( Basilique Notre-Dame ) , 116 rue Notre-Dame ouest ( at place d'Armes/rue Saint-Sulpice ; metro Place-d'Armes ) , ☏ +1514 842-2925 .
#Text=Visitor hours M - F 8AM-4:30PM , Sa 8AM-4PM , Su 12:30PM-4PM .
#Text=Probably the city 's most spectacular church , a gem of Victorian Gothic .
#Text=Service is at 5PM daily and on Sunday morning .
#Text=Entrance is free for worship , but donations are suggested .
#Text=During service , the organ music is not to be missed .
#Text=While it should n't have to be mentioned , tourists should be respectful during services .
#Text=Note that photography is not allowed during services . 20 minute guided tours offered in French or English .
#Text=Adults $ 5 , children 7-17 $ 4 , children under 7 free .
#Text=Montreal Clock Tower
#Text=( Tour de l'Horloge de Montréal ) , Quai de l'Horloge ( metro Champ-de-Mars ) , ☏ +1514 496-7678 .
#Text=Early May and September ( after Labour Day ) : Sa - Su 10AM-7PM ; mid May-mid June and mid August-Labour Day : M - Th 10AM-7PM , F - Su 10AM-9PM ; mid June-mid August : 10AM-9PM daily .
#Text=Also known as the Sailors ' Memorial Clock , the clock tower was built between 1919-1922 as a memorial to sailors lost at sea .
#Text=Its clock mechanism is similar to Big Ben ' s and was known for its accuracy ; sailors would often set their watches by it .
#Text=From May to September , visitors can climb the 192 steps to the top of the tower for a good view of Old Montreal and the St. Lawrence River .
#Text=Free .
#Text=Museums
#Text=Old Montreal has the largest concentration of historical homes and museums — plus the ultra-modern Montréal Science Centre .
#Text=Marguerite-Bourgeoys Museum and Notre-Dame-de-Bon-Secours Chapel

#Text=( Musée Marguerite-Bourgeoys et Chapelle Notre-Dame-de-Bon-Secours ) , 400 rue Saint-Paul est ( at rue Bonsecours ; metro Champ-de-Mars ) , ☏ +1514 282-8670 , fax : +1514 282-8672 , ✉ info@marguerite-bourgeoys.com .
#Text=May-Oct : Tu - Su 10AM-5:30PM ; Oct-Apr : Tu - Su 11AM — 3:30PM . Built in 1655 , Notre-Dame-de-Bon-Secours , is the oldest stone church in Montreal .
#Text=The museum houses artifacts from the church 's history and pays tribute to Marguerite Bourgeoys , Montreal 's first teacher . $ 3 child / $ 4 student / $ 6 adult / $ 4 senior / $ 12 family .
#Text=Pointe-à-Callière
#Text=( Montréal Museum of Archeology and History ) , 350 place Royale ( at place d'Youville/rue de la Commune ; metro Champ-de-Mars ) , ☏ +1514 872-9150 .
#Text=Labour Day to 24 June : Tu - F 10AM-5PM , Sa - Su 11AM-5PM ; 25 June to Labour Day : M - F 10AM-6PM , Sa - Su 11AM-6PM .
#Text=A modern museum built over the ruins of Montreal 's first settlement , Pointe à Callière .

#Text=This museum uses audiovisual technology as well as surrounding archaeological remains to tell the story of Montreal from the first natives to the present day . $ 20 adult / $ 16 seniors ( 65+ ) / $ 12 student ( 13-30 with ID ) / $ 7 youth ( 6-12 ) / free for children ( 0-5 ) / $ 42 family .
#Text=Sir George-Étienne Cartier National Historic Site

#Text=( Lieu historique national de Sir-George-Étienne-Cartier ) , 458 rue Notre-Dame est ( at rue Berri ; metro Champ-de-Mars ) , ☏ +1514 283-2282 . 6 Apr-19 June and 7 Sep-23 Dec : W - Su 10AM-5PM ; 20 June-4 Sep : 10AM-5:30PM daily .
#Text=Reconstruction of two 19th century Victorian homes .
#Text=$ 3.90 adults , $ 3.40 seniors ( 65+ ) , $ 1.90 youth ( 6-16 ) , $ 9.80 families/groups ( up to seven people with a maximum of two adults ) .
#Text=Montréal Science Centre

#Text=( Centre des sciences de Montréal ) , 333 rue de la Commune ouest ( at boul Saint-Laurent on Quai King-Edward ; metro Place-d'Armes , bus 55 or 515 ) , ☏ +1514 496-4724 , toll-free : +1-877-496-4724 . 10AM-5PM daily ; check listings for IMAX movie times .

#Text=Interactive science museum and IMAX theater . IMAX screenings $ 8.50 child / $ 10.50 teen / $ 11.50 adult / $ 10.50 senior ; exhibitions $ 8.50 child / $ 13 teen / $ 15 adult / $ 13 senior / $ 40 family ; see website for details .
#Text=Centre d'histoire de Montréal
#Text=, 335 place d'Youville ( at rue Saint-Pierre ; metro Square-Victoria ) , ☏ +1514 872-3207 , fax : +1514 872-9645 , ✉ chm@ville.montreal.qc.ca . W - Su 10AM-5PM .
#Text=Covering the history of Montreal from its founding in 1535 .
#Text=The museum is housed in a former fire station that dates from 1903 . $ 6 adults , $ 5 seniors , $ 4 children ( 6-17 ) and students , $ 15 families , free for children under 6 .
#Text=Bank of Montréal Museum
#Text=, 129 rue Saint-Jacques ouest ( at place d'Armes ; metro Place-d'Armes ) , ☏ +1514 877-6810 . M - F 10AM-4PM .
#Text=Hands-on museum focusing on the history of banking in Montreal . Free .
#Text=Château Ramezay Museum
#Text=, 280 rue Notre-Dame est ( at rue Saint-Claude ; metro Champ-de-Mars ) , ☏ +1514 861-3708 .
#Text=Jun-Oct 10AM-6PM daily .
#Text=18th century Governor 's residence and gardens full of historical artifacts from daily life . $ 4 child / $ 5 student / $ 8 adults / $ 6 senior / $ 16.50 families .
#Text=DHC/ART
#Text=, 451 rue Saint-Jean ( at rue du Saint-Sacrement ; metro Square-Victoria ) , ☏ +1514 286-6626 . W - F noon-7PM , Sa - Su 11AM-6PM .
#Text=A privately endowed foundation , DHC/ART is a permanent location for exciting and relevant temporary visual arts exhibitions and projects .
#Text=Free .
